headline: Elon Musk Says 'Saving The State' As Delaware Supreme Court Slashes Tesla Legal Fees By Over $100 Million
summary: The Delaware Supreme Court on Friday cut legal fees owed by Tesla Inc. (NASDAQ:TSLA) to $70.9 million from $176.1 million in a shareholder lawsuit over director compensation. The court ruled that a Delaware Chancery Court judge overvalued the settlement when determining attorney fees. Lawyers represented the Detroit firefighter and police pension fund, which sued Tesla directors for excessive self-compensation. Elon Musk responded to the news on X, saying, “Delaware Supreme is saving the state.”

raw.headline: Elon Musk Says 'Saving The State' As Delaware Supreme Court Slashes Tesla Legal Fees By Over $100 Million
raw.summary: The Delaware Supreme Court on Friday cut legal fees owed by Tesla Inc. (NASDAQ:TSLA) to $70.9 million from $176.1 million in a shareholder lawsuit over director compensation. The court ruled that a Delaware Chancery Court judge overvalued the settlement when determining attorney fees. Lawyers represented the Detroit firefighter and police pension fund, which sued Tesla directors for excessive self-compensation. Elon Musk responded to the news on X, saying, “Delaware Supreme is saving the state.”

headline: Trump lowers India tariffs, BLS Jan. jobs report to be delayed
summary: Yahoo Finance Senior Producer John Hyland tracks Monday's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute. The Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) announced that the January jobs report will be delayed due to the partial government shutdown. The US and India have reached a trade agreement. President Trump said tariffs on Indian goods will be lowered from 25% to 18%. Elon Musk is reportedly in advanced talks to combine SpaceX (SPAX.PVT) with Tesla (TSLA) or xAI (XAAI.PVT), according to Bloomberg. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Tesla Made A Little-Known Family Insanely Rich With a $2.9B Deal—Then Cybertruck Delays Wiped Out More Than 99.9% of It

Less than two years later, the value of that contract was quietly revised down to just $7,386. Yes, from $2.9 billion to $7,386. A 99.9997% collapse. headline: Tesla Stock Falls. Ford Could Help Bring Chinese EVs to America.
summary: Tesla  stock fell early Monday after a report that  Ford Motor  was considering a collaboration with Chinese electric-vehicle makers.  Shares of Elon Musk’s EV company were down 2.2% at $420.95 in premarket trading, while  and  futures were off 0.5% and 0.1%, respectively.  The move came after a Financial Times report that Ford has held discussions with China’s  Xiaomi  and  BYD  to help bring Chinese EVs into America.

Shares of Elon Musk’s EV company were down 2.2% at $420.95 in premarket trading, while  and  futures were off 0.5% and 0.1%, respectively.  The move came after a Financial Times report that Ford has held discussions with China’s  Xiaomi  and  BYD  to help bring Chinese EVs into America.

headline: The $3 Trillion AI Data Center Build-Out Becomes All-Consuming For Debt Markets
summary: Not even the world’s biggest technology companies—not Amazon.com, not Microsoft or Meta Platforms—are prepared to foot the bill with only their own cash.  The massive equity investments in private companies such as OpenAI and Anthropic don’t come close to this Industrial Revolution-size cost.  “The numbers are like nothing any of us who have been in this business for 25 years have seen,” says Matt McQueen, who oversees global credit, securitized products and municipal banking and markets at Bank of America Corp. “You have to turn over all avenues to make this work.”

raw.headline: The $3 Trillion AI Data Center Build-Out Becomes All-Consuming For Debt Markets
raw.summary: Not even the world’s biggest technology companies—not Amazon.com, not Microsoft or Meta Platforms—are prepared to foot the bill with only their own cash.  The massive equity investments in private companies such as OpenAI and Anthropic don’t come close to this Industrial Revolution-size cost.  “The numbers are like nothing any of us who have been in this business for 25 years have seen,” says Matt McQueen, who oversees global credit, securitized products and municipal banking and markets at Bank of America Corp. “You have to turn over all avenues to make this work.”

headline: US futures, Asian shares slip, tracking Wall Street's retreat, while oil falls more than $2
summary: U.S. futures and Asian shares skidded Monday and oil prices fell more than $2 a barrel.  In South Korea, the Kospi tumbled 4.6% to 4,982.54 as worries revived over a potential bubble in the craze for artificial intelligence.  Samsung Electronics gave up 3.5%, while chip maker SK Hynix sank 5.6%.
